snippet: The case of a pregnant 11-year old girl who was raped has set off a national debate about abortion in one of the most socially conservative countries in Latin America.
abstract: Case in Chile of pregnant 11-year-old girl who was raped sets off national debate about abortion in one of Latin America's most socially conservatives countries, where abortions have been outlawed since 1973.
lead_paragraph: The case of a pregnant 11-year old girl who was raped has set off a national debate about abortion in one of the most socially conservative countries in Latin America.
